Author: edu
Content: Seems like a bad soap opera... Reads like a bad soap opera... Lesson, skip what seems like a soap opera.

Author: marcus
Content:
Absolutely and I am not saying that going after them isn't the correct strategy sometimes, but you should always be aware of your balance between these two poles.

All I'm trying to convey is that you shouldn't assume that they represent your average customer. Think of the difference between an iPhone and a Treo or BlackBerry, iPhone was made for the general user who never owned a smartphone in his life, the Treos & BlackBerries are designed for the power-user/taste-maker.

Author: jey
Content:
I read one or two kb of that and skimmed the rest and I gained zero bits of information.

As far as I can see, this doesn't meet the criterion that Hacker News articles should be "interesting", even for a wide definition of "interesting". Please, let's not turn this into "Web 2.0 Gossip News".

Author: quasimodo
Title: What to look for when joining a start up?
Content:
i am young, no wife and kids, and am not in SF, but moving to SF in a couple months to get into the game. i have a technical degree, have worked for start ups before, but can not program. i have the start up affliction.

what types of jobs are available for a non-coding, technical person in a start up? what do you look for when joining a start up? what can i expect as far as avg employee number?
